reviews.text: Amazing place.... The church is entirely made with gold and mines are right next to it... Pretty close from the center  and if u like silver they have great quality  and great prices compared to other states I have been... Everything in that town seems genuinely nice!!!! Loved it all... I thought I was in Europe.
Some parts of the church are under restoration or closed off altogether but a section on the side is used as a museum.
Calm cool restorative.
Very nice church as usual of Mexico
Like :v

The Church of San Diego and The University of Guanajuato, which are nearly three hundred years old, could be confused with any medieval building from Europe and personally it reminds me of Salamanca in Spain due to its colonial architecture. Churches are of great importance in the religious culture of Mexico; expect to find several of them and plan to enter the biggest ones to admire the architecture. There are several historic buildings as well including the Alhóndiga de Granaditas building, which is not very eye-catching but it was a key building during the Independence War in 1810, where the heads of the most important revolutionaries were hanged on the four corners
Ok
可能有一些不起眼，但是這個教堂是瓜納華托最早的一批教堂之一。
Emblemático lugar lleno de misterios y abusos de la iglesia católica
Arquitetura fantástica.

Nice church in the top of hills. I came here because I read that you can get a overlook of the city from here. That's not true, lol. The church, however, is pretty nice, especially the inside. You can get a bit the view of Guanajuato if you walk down a bit. But the road is not build for pedestrians so it's a bit dangerous to walk.  If you only want a city view and not interested in church, this place is not gonna worth your trip.

Great place to visit, even better if you can see a concert here. The acoustics are incredible. Transportation was a bit of a pain. Took a taxi there then a local bus back to the centro. There is also a mine to check out as well. I recommend you couple these two destinations in one visit.
Believe it or not! This church is exceptional along my month around Mexico! What an architecture !!
It's a very interesting place to visit because that church has a beautiful baroque architecture with a lot of history
Very amazing church. Breathtaking. Absolute Must See. Definately Go Visit!!

A lot of activity happens here at all hours of the night and throughout the whole week. This is where you want to be if you're out at night in the city. Lots of restaurants in the area and mariachis walking around playing music. A lot of people out just enjoying the night talking a walk or dining.

Excellent presentation of Mexican history, culture and art. Well organized,  tastefully presented, designed for good flow of people. This is a must see museum in Guanajuato. Has a variety of styles of Mexican art. It could be improved by having more in English, even English guided tours would be wonderful. Well worth the low cost of admission.

Gorgeous!!!! Having an architectural background I was impressed. We had the opportunity to watch the symphony here as well. For $100 pesos ($5 USD) it was incredible. Not only tour around during the day, but try see a show if you can.
beautiful with wonderful performances at incredibly low cost. worth touring even if not going to a show. usually there is great street theatre in front of it.
A very pretty museum, with a very complete guided tour. The main hall is something to behold.
Excelente ambiente educativo
Muy buena
Por la accesibilidad.
Beautiful view! Excellent for visitors and travelers who wants to know how the city was 2 centuries ago

Excelente vista!
La capital (Guanajuato) ofrece interminables lugares fantásticos incluso donde crees que no hay nada, te encuentras un lugar como éste. 
Vista de lejos pareciera una cortina de una presa, los muros de un castillo o algo por el estilo.
Esta mina aún funciona y produce.
Mecánico para elevación y descenso hacia la  mina
Hermoso lugar te acuerdas negrita

Uno de los centros mineros más importantes de la región, el cual aun sigue en funcionamiento.
Desde lejos parece un fuerte, lo cual le da soporte.

They recently raised their prices and hit tourists the most.  Make sure to ask about the senior discount since it is not advertised very well.

While the mummies are interesting to see, the presentation could be easily improved.  The text size on the few descriptive signs is very small and some can't be read through the glass enclosures.  Also, there are quite a few historic photographs on the walls but they can't be seen since they are not lit.  Finally, it appears they know the background of the folks on display, but only describe a few.  The ones they do describe are interesting stories and the museum would be greatly improved if they would include more.

Very interesting place!! My kids enjoyed the tour. Must go place. Please make sure you park in the main parking lot. There are guys standing outside the museum telling you to park in the lot next to the museum but DO NOT park there.  The correct parking lot has a lifting arm and a box where you will be given a parking pass.

Really gross and of  very minute historical or cultural significance. Just a bunch of handing preserved  bodies of adults. Leading to dead babies and finally y a fetus and its pregnant mother. DON'T BRING CHILDREN. As a psychologist, I can tell you that even if children don't scream or freak out, they can be traumatized by something like this. Their silence often means it more than they can process and not that they so so mature that they can take it. Tip: Outside of old city, so you need taxi to get there. Getting taxi back can be a big hassle. You need to walk 10- 15 minutes down the mountain to an area with taxis.

Really weird museum to visit. I've seen families with young kids and they were surprisingly not scared at all. They have a lot of mommies in display ( probably around 40 or so ). They have mommies of men, women and children too, I thought the ones from children were a little unnerving. The visit doesn't take very long, mine took between 15 and 25 minutes and I took many pictures of the exhibition. I recommend this visit during the week days if possible to avoid crowds.

A truly astonishing experience. Morbid and fascinating at the same time, this is a large Museum with dozens and dozens of well-preserved mummies. They have the smallest infant mummy in the world. It's beautifully curated and provides an interesting history lesson and a lot to think about. Situated just outside of the center of Guanajuato, you will want to take a cab up the hill to the museum.

This museum exceeded our expectations! We really enjoyed the many levels and exhibits of Don Quixote. Makes for a great two-three hour visit if art museums are your thing. This is also one of the only museums that has transcribed the Spanish text to English. Very helpful, thank you. Loved the book store as well. Highly recommend a visit! Visit on Tuesday when it is gratis!
wonderful museum. a must see for quixote fans. free on one day of the week, i think thurs.  coffee shop has best coffe in gto

Inspirational

Great coffee shop inside.

Free on Tuesday
Tuesday is free, so got a look to an amazing art for free. Wonderful paintings in which you can sense the emotion of the artists.

Excelente intimate museo housed in a lovely colonial building. interesting curatorial vision highlighting traditional and modern painting, drawing and sculpture inspired by the writings and myth(s) of Quixote. Not as crowded as gto's more publicized museos. Reasonably priced. note: must climb stairs to see all galleries.

They recently raised their prices and hit tourists the most.  Make sure to ask about the senior discount since it is not advertised very well.

The concerts on sunday tend to be just great, most of the time classical music, occationally jazz and other kinds.
Nice and varied blue hair concerts on Sundays
Lugar donde se presenta buena música académica y popular en un ambiente amigable y familiar
Es un lugar muy agradable, se respira atención, cultura y tranquilidad
Está muy bonito para fiestas grandes se los recomiendo es muy bonito

Beautiful place! Be sure to stop by at night and see the musicians!
Must see

MUSEO DEL EX-CONVENTO DIEGUINO

Debajo de Guanajuato, está otro Guanajuato. Basta asomarse por un costado del templo de San Diego para darse cuenta de ello. Lo que usted ve es una parte del antiguo Convento de San Pedro de Alcántara que en su época abarcaba hasta el Teatro Juárez y el hotel San Diego.  En 1663 los franciscanos descalzos fundaron este convento con su templo de San Diego de Alcalá, aunque no es exactamente el que hoy se encuentra frente al Jardín Unión.

Este cambio se debe a las inundaciones que por años afectaron a la ciudad, obligando a sus habitantes a reconstruir sus moradas y edificios - elevando varios metros del propio nivel del piso, usando las estructuras originales como los cimentos de las nuevas. La zona mas afectada por estos inundaciones es donde corría el río, hoy en día, la calle subterránea. La última vez que ocurrió esto fue en 1780 y de esa época data el convento que ahora puede verse parcialmente gracias a los trabajos de investigación y recuperación que hoy pueden apreciarse en el Museo Dieguino.
Excelente atención a los asistentes, indispensable visitar para conocer la historia del Guanajuato antiguo.
Excelente lugar histórico. El guía es genial
Nice restaurant rigjt there in downtown.  Great variety and delicious options and affordable.  The breakfast packages are great.
This place have few variety of options, near places offer the same and cheaper, the service is nice but some of the options have a too much fat, also some of the drinks feel pretty reduced.
Just amazing place to eat. Good location just in the middle of the city
This is not a great choice in Guanajuato. The service is pretty slow and the food is below average. Not worth the price.

The worst we had so far had the fish in garlic and it was slimy with no flavor I ordered tacos de pulpo and the octopus still had its beak and was burnt tasted like burnt rubber. My wife orders the carne Asada and it was a slice of rubber the chips taste like burnt popcorn I will never eat here again. Only gave it a star because the waiter was nice and was really trying

I had read good things about Delica Mitsu and finally had the opportunity to go the other day. I definitely wasn’t disappointed. The California rolls with fresh shrimp were incredibly fresh and delicious and the curry shrimp ramen was very flavorful and satisfying. The presentation was beautiful and the service fast, friendly, and professional. The place has a nice atmosphere inside as well and the dishes were very affordable. I plan to go back multiple times and try everything! The only thing I can pick at is that I wish they offered pickled ginger to go with the sushi (I know you can buy it affordably at La Comer, sold buy a Mexican company), and I usually say the opposite about sweetness, but their home-made ginger ale would be even better if they added a little bit of sweetener, or provided this option at the table.
Great place for lunch. Plenty of vegan options. The bento option is great and you get to try many different dishes.
Best Food i have tasted in guanajuato so far
Nice decor.  Kind staff.  Good food.
A bit lacking in atmosphere, and the food took a while, but the staff were very friendly and the food was fine.

Ordered two steaks, fantastic flavor, perfectly cooked. Had a pasta with seafood that was also fantastic. Also had a piece of salmon that was delicious. Great, fresh salads to start. And some fantastic tomato soup and corn soups. They have a great spicy salsa if you ask for it!
the presentation of the dishes caught our attention, the food with good flavor, the service more or less well. But if we recommend this place.

This restaurant was delicious! The ceviche is flavorful and crisp in flavors. The pasta you can tell is freshly made and cooked to perfection. The steak was...🤔. I had ordered the "New York bañado en mantequilla y ajo". The steak came with a great sear, and flavor was delicious, however the steak was a Ribeye vs New York Strip. Be aware if ordering that the name is not identifying the type of steak. Aside from that, everything from ambience to staff attention and flavor of food was some of the best in Guanajuato.
Beautiful restaurant with fantastic menu! The bone marrow dish is delicious.

Cozy, upscale spot for some fabulous food. The menu is very creative, I had the "Chuleta de cerdo con frutas rojas" and it was absolutely amazing, I would never have thought to pair pork with something more appropriate for a crepe but the strawberries, black berries and raspberries added a lovely tart and sweet component to the otherwise succulent chop. Just wish our stay was longer so we could explore more of their menu...Highly recommended.

Service was attentive and the food was good except for the beef wellington.  The pastry was undercooked/raw.  Our server took it back to the kitchen and they attempted to correct it (rather than starting over). 3.5 stars. I'd give the place another try.
Very delicious restaurant. Recommended to me by a local and it was great. Wonderful terrace to sit at and watch the people go by. Located in a building with great shops and art galleries as well.

This is a beautiful cafe in a gorgeous building with a great view. I came for breakfast and the coffee wasn’t too bad (not the best in Guanajuato). The hot cakes were perfect though. Super fast wifi and a quiet spacious place to work for digital nomads. Recommend!

Nice enough atmosphere, ok service and presentation of the food was pretty basic. Food was a bit bland and underwhelming for the cost. Well prepared, but nothing special. Nothing I couldn't have made at home. Can do a lot better in Guanajuato for the price.

Semi casual restaurant on second floor in a multi use building containing art exhibits, yoga at upper courtyard. Some use El Midi as a meeting place. Excellent chef made meals with rich assortment of liquor. Friendly staff and run by a courteous french women. Chess available.
Beauty place
Habitaciones muy agradables, muy buena limpieza. La ubicación está excelente, a pocas cuadras del Teatro Juárez.
El servicio es excelente, y la comida es muy buena. ¡El chocolate caliente es delicioso!
Muy limpio, los encargados muy atentos y flexibles.
